[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/transaction_info/mod.rs] [Schema: TransactionInfoSchema] [Iterator invalidation] Can modifications to TransactionInfoSchema invalidate in-progress iterators from get_transaction_info_iter(), causing iterator to skip or duplicate entries? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/transaction_info/mod.rs] [Schema: TransactionInfoSchema] [Batch commit race] Can race conditions between SchemaBatch commits cause TransactionInfo writes to be reordered, violating the Version ordering invariant? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/transaction_info/mod.rs] [Schema: TransactionInfoSchema] [Lock-free corruption] Since RocksDB is lock-free, can concurrent put operations for adjacent Versions cause data corruption if writes are interleaved at byte level? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/transaction_info/mod.rs] [Schema: TransactionInfoSchema] [Restore version conflict] During restore operations, can TransactionInfo records be imported with Version keys that conflict with existing data, causing silent overwrite of valid transactions? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/transaction_info/mod.rs] [Schema: TransactionInfoSchema] [Checkpoint corruption] Can corrupted checkpoint files restore invalid TransactionInfo data that passes BCS deserialization but contains inconsistent hash values? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/transaction_info/mod.rs] [Function: decode_value()] [Restore bomb] Can a malicious backup contain extremely large TransactionInfo values that cause memory exhaustion during restoration, preventing node recovery? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/transaction_info/mod.rs] [Function: decode_key()] [Error propagation] Does decode_key() properly propagate all error types from ensure_slice_len_eq and read_u64, or can some errors be silently swallowed causing invalid versions to be accepted? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/transaction_info/mod.rs] [Function: encode_value()] [Serialization failure] If bcs::to_bytes() fails due to resource exhaustion, is the error properly handled, or can it cause transaction commitment to partially succeed leaving inconsistent state? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/transaction_info/mod.rs] [Function: decode_value()] [Panic safety] Can bcs::from_bytes() panic on malformed input instead of returning an error, causing validator node crashes when reading corrupted TransactionInfo? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/transaction_info/mod.rs] [Schema: TransactionInfoSchema] [Accumulator mismatch] Can TransactionInfo be written without corresponding TransactionAccumulatorSchema entry, breaking the invariant that every transaction has accumulator proof? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/transaction_info/mod.rs] [Schema: TransactionInfoSchema] [Event root mismatch] Can event_root_hash in TransactionInfo be inconsistent with actual events in EventSchema, enabling proof verification bypass? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/transaction_info/mod.rs] [Schema: TransactionInfoSchema] [Write set mismatch] Can state_change_hash in TransactionInfo diverge from actual WriteSetSchema data, breaking state transition verification? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/transaction_info/mod.rs] [Schema: TransactionInfoSchema] [Transaction mismatch] Can TransactionInfo exist without corresponding Transaction in TransactionSchema, or vice versa, causing inconsistent ledger state? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/transaction_info/mod.rs] [Schema: TransactionInfoSchema] [Version rollback] Can an attacker force rollback of committed TransactionInfo by providing conflicting proof that references earlier versions, causing state inconsistency? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/transaction_info/mod.rs] [Schema: TransactionInfoSchema] [Sync poisoning] Can a malicious peer provide TransactionInfo with valid signatures but incorrect state roots during state sync, causing honest nodes to commit invalid state? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/transaction_info/mod.rs] [Function: decode_value()] [Proof replay] Can old TransactionInfo records be replayed with valid proofs to overwrite newer versions, enabling transaction history rewriting attacks? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/transaction_info/mod.rs] [Function: decode_key()] [Stack overflow] Can recursive or deeply nested calls to decode_key() cause stack overflow if processing malicious iterator data? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/transaction_info/mod.rs] [Function: encode_value()] [Heap exhaustion] Can encoding extremely large TransactionInfo structures (via hash fields) cause heap exhaustion and node crashes? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/transaction_info/mod.rs] [Function: decode_value()] [Use after free] Can concurrent deletion of TransactionInfo while decode_value() is reading cause use-after-free if RocksDB's memory is reclaimed? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/transaction_info/mod.rs] [Function: encode_key()] [Endian swap attack] On big-endian architectures, does to_be_bytes() correctly produce the same byte representation as on little-endian systems, or can architecture differences cause version ordering mismatches? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/transaction_info/mod.rs] [Function: decode_key()] [Byte order verification] Does read_u64::<BigEndian>() properly validate byte order markers, or can it accept little-endian data causing Version to be incorrectly decoded by 2^64 factor? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/transaction_info/mod.rs] [Schema: TransactionInfoSchema] [Iterator overflow] Can get_transaction_info_iter() overflow when start_version + num_transaction_infos exceeds u64::MAX, causing wrap-around and returning wrong transaction range? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/transaction_info/mod.rs] [Schema: TransactionInfoSchema] [Continuous version assumption] Does expect_continuous_versions() properly validate that there are no gaps in Version sequence, or can missing TransactionInfo cause silent skipping? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/transaction_info/mod.rs] [Schema: TransactionInfoSchema] [Iterator bounds] Can an attacker request num_transaction_infos = 0 or negative value (via type confusion) causing iterator to return invalid range? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/transaction_info/mod.rs] [Function: decode_value()] [Hash length validation] Does BCS deserialization validate that HashValue fields (transaction_hash, state_change_hash, event_root_hash) are exactly 32 bytes, or can truncated hashes pass validation? (High)
